agents.name: CacheManager
agents.docstring: Caches API responses using a file-based cache.

agents.name: SelfReflectionAgent
agents.docstring:
Implements the 'Critic' role in the Cycle.
Evaluates drafts against a 'Constitution'.

agents.name: AgentPacket
agents.docstring:
Standardized packet for inter-agent communication.
Merged: Adopts 'sender'/'recipient' (main) for clarity over 'source'/'destination'.
Retains 'metadata' (guide) for extensibility and adds automatic UUID generation.

agents.name: IntegratedAgentState
agents.docstring:
Represents the integrated state of an agent.
Merged: Uses specific fields (memory, tools) from 'main' for structure,
but adds 'custom_state' to capture the generic 'state_data' from the 'guide' branch.

agents.name: AgentInput
agents.docstring: Standard input schema for all System 2 agents.

agents.name: AgentOutput
agents.docstring: Standard output schema for all System 2 agents.

agents.name: AgentConfig
agents.docstring: Configuration for a single agent.

agents.name: AgentsYamlConfig
agents.docstring: Schema for config/agents.yaml

agents.name: AgentTelemetry
agents.docstring:
Aggregated telemetry data for a specific agent.
Merged: Retained the context manager (guide) as it significantly reduces
boilerplate code when instrumenting agents.

agents.name: AgentState
agents.docstring: The HNASP Envelope: The Single Source of Truth.

agents.name: MarketDiscoveryAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for the 'Discovery Layer' of the Financial Framework.
Implements 'Real Search Pull' using yfinance to dynamically find assets.

agents.name: AdamRiskArchitect
agents.docstring: Implements the 'Adam Risk Architect' persona (v24.1).

agents.name: RiskAnalyst
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for qualitative risk assessment.
It synthesizes quantitative data (from RatioCalculator) with qualitative data (10-K text)
to produce a holistic risk view.

agents.name: RepoContextManager
agents.docstring:
Singleton to load and parse repository documentation (AGENTS.md, README.md)
to provide dynamic context for Agents and Routers.

agents.name: AuditAgent
agents.docstring:
Implements 'Audit-as-Code' logic.
Protocol: Sovereign AI Architecture Framework

agents.name: CreditMemoOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Orchestrates the Credit Memo generation pipeline.
Protocol: ADAM-V-NEXT (Agent Swarm)

agents.name: CreditAgent
agents.docstring: Base class for Credit Memo Agents.

agents.name: ArchivistAgent
agents.docstring: Retrieves unstructured and structured context.

agents.name: QuantAgent
agents.docstring: Handles financial spreading, PD/LGD modeling, and Scenario Analysis.

agents.name: RiskOfficerAgent
agents.docstring: Identifies Red Flags and compliance issues.

agents.name: WriterAgent
agents.docstring: Synthesizes the final memo sections with citations.

agents.name: SystemTwoAgent
agents.docstring:
Performs a second-pass critique and validation of the generated memo.
Protocol: System 2 Thinking

agents.name: WealthManager
agents.docstring:
Manages Wealth Planning, Trusts, and Beneficiary Goals.
Includes Monte Carlo simulation for goal probability.

agents.name: ScrubberAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent A: Ingests raw file and outputs cleaned text/artifact.
Uses GoldStandardScrubber and FileHandlers.

agents.name: VerifierAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent B: Cross-references claims.
Simulates checking against SEC filings or external sources.

agents.name: FormatterAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent C: Converts verified data into strictly typed output format.
Ensures the final JSONL structure is valid.

agents.name: PermissionManager
agents.docstring: Centralized Permission Manager for RBAC.

agents.name: AlphaAgent
agents.docstring: Mock RL Agent (Actor-Critic style).

agents.name: QLearningAgent
agents.docstring: Implements Q-Learning algorithm for discrete state and action spaces.

agents.name: SNCAnalystWorkflow
agents.docstring:
A portable, modular workflow engine for the SNC Analyst pipeline.
It chains together AOPL prompts to perform end-to-end reasoning.

agents.name: MacroAgent
agents.docstring:
Simulates external Macroeconomic or Political shocks.
Merges EconomicAgent and PoliticalAgent into one systematic driver.

agents.name: MarketAgent
agents.docstring: An agent representing a market participant with a specific risk aversion level.

agents.name: AgentForge
agents.docstring: Generates synthetic test cases for failing domains.

agents.name: ConvictionManager
agents.docstring:
Tracks and manages the 'Conviction Score' of various agents over time.
Simulates a 'Reputation System' where agents gain/lose conviction based on consensus alignment.

agents.name: SwarmManager
agents.docstring:
The Central Orchestrator for the Adam Swarm Architecture.
Responsible for lifecycle management, resource allocation, and 
inter-agent coordination for Market Mayhem and Financial Twin simulations.

agents.name: OrderManager
agents.docstring: Manages order state.

agents.name: OrderManager
agents.docstring:
Manages the lifecycle of orders (Place, Modify, Cancel).
Abstracts the API complexity from the strategy.

agents.name: QuantAgent
agents.docstring: Specialized in extracting tabular data, running calculations, and analyzing Excel models.

agents.name: LegalAgent
agents.docstring: Specialized in RAG over long-context legal documents (Credit Agreements, Indentures).

agents.name: MarketAgent
agents.docstring: Specialized in web search and competitor analysis.

agents.name: AgentTools
agents.docstring:
Centralized tool definitions for the Vertical Risk Agent.
Implements strict typing and error handling.

agents.name: ITOpsManager
agents.docstring: Manages the global fleet of resources.

agents.name: FundamentalAnalystAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent for performing fundamental analysis of companies.

This agent analyzes financial statements, calculates key financial ratios,
performs valuation modeling (DCF and comparables), and assesses financial health.
It relies on DataRetrievalAgent for fetching company data via A2A communication.

Updated to support standard AgentInput/AgentOutput interface.

agents.name: MarketSentimentAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for gauging market sentiment from a variety of sources,
such as news articles, social media, and prediction markets.

agents.name: QueryUnderstandingAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent responsible for understanding the user's query and
determining which other agents are relevant to answer it.
This version incorporates LLM-based intent recognition and skill-based routing.

agents.name: QuantumMonteCarloAgent
agents.docstring: Orchestrates Quantum-Accelerated Monte Carlo simulations.

agents.name: EventDrivenRiskAgent
agents.docstring: Agent that tracks and assesses the market impact of events.

agents.name: RAGAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent that implements a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline.
It can ingest documents and answer queries based on the ingested content.

agents.name: ReportGeneratorAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent responsible for generating final reports by synthesizing
analysis from other agents.

agents.name: ReflectorAgent
agents.docstring:
The Reflector Agent performs meta-cognition.
It analyzes the output of other agents or the system's own reasoning traces
to identify logical fallacies, hallucination risks, or missing context.

v23 Update: Wraps `ReflectorGraph` for iterative self-correction.

agents.name: RegulatoryComplianceAgent
agents.docstring:
Ensures adherence to all applicable financial regulations and compliance standards.

Core Capabilities:
- Monitors regulatory changes and trends across relevant jurisdictions.
- Analyzes financial transactions and activities for compliance.
- Identifies potential regulatory risks and provides mitigation strategies.
- Generates compliance reports and audit trails.
- Collaborates with other agents to incorporate compliance considerations.
- Provides guidance on interacting with regulatory bodies.
- Adapts to changing political landscapes and regulatory priorities.

agents.name: MetaCognitiveAgent
agents.docstring: The Meta-Cognitive Agent monitors the performance of other agents.

agents.name: KnowledgeContributionAgent
agents.docstring: An agent that extracts key findings from a report and formats them as structured data.

agents.name: ProfileAgent
agents.docstring:
ProfileAgent serves as the high-level interface for user-driven commands
within the Adam ecosystem. It routes 'adam.*' commands to the appropriate
subsystems, including Industry Specialists, Developer Swarm, and the
Autonomous Improvement Loop.

agents.name: PortfolioOptimizationAgent
agents.docstring: Agent for portfolio optimization using both Classical (Mean-Variance) and AI (LSTM) approaches.

agents.name: AIPoweredPortfolioOptimizationAgent
agents.docstring: Legacy wrapper for PortfolioOptimizationAgent to maintain backward compatibility.

agents.name: AgentBase
agents.docstring:
Abstract base class for all agents in the system.
Defines the common interface and behavior expected of all agents.
This version incorporates MCP, A2A, Semantic Kernel, HNASP, Memory persistence, and Boot Protocol.

agents.name: StrategicForesightAgent
agents.docstring:
Strategic Foresight Agent

A unified intelligence unit acting as the system's "Pre-Crime" and National Security division.
It integrates high-fidelity financial modeling (OSWM, Quantum, Black Swan) with 
geopolitical strategic analysis.

agents.name: AdaptiveAlgoTradingAgent
agents.docstring:
An extension of AlgoTradingAgent that uses Reinforcement Learning (Q-Learning)
to dynamically select the best trading strategy based on market conditions.

agents.name: Meta19Agent
agents.docstring:
Monitors the reasoning and outputs of other agents to ensure logical consistency,
coherence, and alignment with core principles. Deprecated as part of Adam v19 to v22.

agents.name: HNASPAgent
agents.docstring: An agent that implements the Hybrid Neurosymbolic Agent State Protocol (HNASP).

agents.name: RiskAssessmentAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for assessing various types of investment risks,
such as market risk, credit risk, and operational risk.

Philosophy:
Risk is not a number; it's a distribution. We strive to quantify the tails.

agents.name: RedTeamAgent
agents.docstring:
The Red Team Agent acts as an internal adversary to the system.

### Functionality:
It generates novel and challenging scenarios (stress tests) to validate risk models before
strategies are deployed. This is a critical component of the "Sovereign Financial Intelligence"
architecture (v23.5), ensuring that the system is robust against "Black Swan" events.

### Architecture:
In v23.5, this agent implements an internal **Adversarial Self-Correction Loop** using LangGraph.
Instead of a single-shot generation, it iteratively refines its attack scenarios until they
meet a severity threshold.

### Workflow:
1.  **Generate Attack**: Uses `CounterfactualReasoningSkill` to invert assumptions in a credit memo.
2.  **Simulate Impact**: Estimates the financial damage (e.g., VaR spike) of the scenario.
3.  **Critique**: Checks if the scenario is severe enough (Severity > Threshold).
4.  **Escalate**: If too mild, it loops back to Generate Attack with instructions to "Escalate".

agents.name: BehavioralEconomicsAgent
agents.docstring: Analyzes market data and user interactions for signs of cognitive biases and irrational behavior.

agents.name: MarketMakingAgent
agents.docstring:
Agentic wrapper around the Avellaneda-Stoikov model.
Implements a 'System Brain' component that dynamically adapts risk aversion (Gamma)
based on market conditions (Volatility, Inventory Risk), simulating an RL policy.

agents.name: FraudDetectionAgent
agents.docstring: A specialized agent for detecting financial anomalies and simulating restatements.

agents.name: FinancialModelingAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent for performing comprehensive financial modeling, including DCF valuation, sensitivity analysis,
stress testing, Monte Carlo simulations, and ratio analysis.

agents.name: ResultAggregationAgent
agents.docstring:
Combines results from multiple agents.  Initially uses simple concatenation,
but is designed for future LLM integration.

agents.name: AdaptiveAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent implementation that fully embodies the 'Protocol Paradox' resolutions:
1. Adaptive Conviction (Switching between Direct/MCP)
2. State Anchors (Async Drift protection)
3. Tool RAG (Context Saturation mitigation)

agents.name: SNCAnalystAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent for performing Shared National Credit (SNC) analysis.
This agent analyzes company data based on regulatory guidelines to assign an SNC rating.
It retrieves data via A2A communication with DataRetrievalAgent and can use SK skills.

agents.name: TechnicalAnalystAgent
agents.docstring: Agent responsible for technical analysis of financial assets.

agents.name: PromptGenerationAgent
agents.docstring: An agent that generates a high-quality prompt from a user query.

agents.name: QuantitativeRiskAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for calculating quantitative risk metrics such as Value at Risk (VaR)
and Conditional Value at Risk (CVaR).

agents.name: BlackSwanAgent
agents.docstring:
Counterfactual 'Black Swan' Engine.
Autonomously generates stress scenarios and calculates 'Probability of Default' sensitivity.

agents.name: MacroeconomicAnalysisAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for analyzing macroeconomic indicators (GDP, Inflation, etc.)
to provide a broad market context.

Refactored for v23 Architecture (Path A).

agents.name: AgentForge
agents.docstring:
The AgentForge is responsible for the dynamic creation of new agents.
It uses templates and configuration to generate agent code and add them
to the system at runtime. This version incorporates advanced features
like skill schema generation and A2A wiring.

agents.name: DataRetrievalAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for retrieving data from various configured sources.
Now integrates with DataFetcher for live market data.

agents.name: AnomalyDetectionAgent
agents.docstring:
Detects anomalies and unusual patterns in financial markets and company data.

Core Capabilities:
- Leverages various statistical methods and machine learning algorithms for comprehensive anomaly detection.
- Integrates with Adam's knowledge base for context-aware analysis.
- Employs XAI techniques to provide explanations for detected anomalies.
- Collaborates with other agents for in-depth investigation and reporting.

Agent Network Interactions:
- DataRetrievalAgent: Accesses market and company data from the knowledge graph.
- FundamentalAnalystAgent: Receives alerts for potential anomalies in financial statements.
- RiskAssessmentAgent: Provides risk scores and context for detected anomalies.
- AlertGenerationAgent: Generates alerts for significant anomalies.

Dynamic Adaptation and Evolution:
- Continuously learns and adapts based on feedback and new data.
- Automated testing and monitoring ensure accuracy and reliability.

agents.name: CyclicalReasoningAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent capable of cyclical reasoning, routing its output back to itself
or other agents for iterative improvement.

agents.name: ImpactAnalysisAgent
agents.docstring: Analyzes cross-sector correlations and systemic risks.

agents.name: ArchitectAgent
agents.docstring:
The Architect Agent is responsible for maintaining, optimizing, and evolving
the system infrastructure and reasoning logic.

agents.name: ManagementAssessmentAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 1: Entity & Management Assessment.
Analyzes capital allocation, insider alignment, and CEO tone.

agents.name: OptimizedGalleryAgent
agents.docstring:
Demonstration agent that uses RedundancyOptimizationMixin to securely and efficiently
fetch 'gallery data' (simulated) with fallback capabilities.

agents.name: RegulatorySNCAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized Agent: The Regulator (Government Employee Persona).

This agent strictly applies the "Interagency Guidance on Leveraged Lending" (2013).
It does NOT use flexible cash flow models or future projections.
It focuses on rigid compliance: Leverage < 6x, Ability to Repay < 50% of Free Cash Flow.

Role: "The Brake"

agents.name: CreditSentryAgent
agents.docstring:
"The Hawk" - Solvency Assessment Engine.
Responsibility: Stress testing, FCCR calculation, Cycle Detection (Fractured Ouroboros), J.Crew Detection.

agents.name: MarketRegimeAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for classifying the current market regime (e.g., Bull, Bear, Choppy, Volatile)
using statistical metrics such as Hurst Exponent, ADX, and Volatility ratios.
This acts as a 'Force Multiplier' for other agents by providing context on *how* to trade.

agents.name: DeepSectorAnalyst
agents.docstring:
A Deep Vertical Agent specialized in generating detailed sector-specific
stress scenarios using the Generative Risk Engine.

agents.name: SovereignAIAnalystAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent for analyzing the 'Sovereign AI' landscape.
It focuses on the intersection of National Security, AI Infrastructure (Capex),
and Geopolitical fragmentation.

agents.name: CovenantAnalystAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 3 Helper: Covenant Analysis.
Parses credit agreements (or simulates them) for maintenance covenants.

Enhanced Capabilities:
- Technical Default Prediction (Headroom Compression)
- Springing Covenant Monitoring (Revolver Utilization)

agents.name: CryptoArbitrageAgent
agents.docstring:
A specialized agent that monitors cryptocurrency prices across multiple exchanges
to identify arbitrage opportunities.

agents.name: StrategicSNCAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized Agent for performing Shared National Credit (SNC) simulations.

Acts as a virtual 'Senior Credit Officer', orchestrating the debate between:
1. The Regulator (RegulatorySNCAgent) - "The Brake"
2. The Strategist (Internal Logic) - "The Gas"

It uses the Risk Consensus Engine to simulate a dialogue and determine the final outcome.

agents.name: CreditConformanceAgent
agents.docstring:
Tier-2 Generative AI Agent for Credit Risk Conformance.
Implements a multi-layered architecture for regulatory and policy conformance.

agents.name: SNCRatingAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized Agent for performing Shared National Credit (SNC) simulations.

Acts as a virtual 'Senior Credit Officer', applying regulatory frameworks
(OCC/Fed/FDIC) to classify debt facilities based on:
1. Primary Repayment Source (Cash Flow/EBITDA)
2. Secondary Repayment Source (Collateral/Enterprise Value)

Developer Note:
---------------
This agent implements the "Interagency Guidance on Leveraged Lending" logic.
It separates the borrower-level rating (Ability to Repay) from the facility-level
rating (Loss Given Default), allowing for "notching up" based on collateral.

agents.name: QuantumSearchAgent
agents.docstring:
QuantumSearchAgent: A specialized agent that acts as a bridge between
classical search intent and the AVG (AdamVanGrover) hybrid quantum-classical
optimization framework.

It simulates the process of finding "needles" (anomalies, specific keys)
in massive datasets (haystacks) by leveraging the AVGSearch engine.

agents.name: RootNodeAgent
agents.docstring: An agent that solves complex problems by building a search tree of reasoning steps.

agents.name: MacroLiquidityAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for assessing global macro liquidity conditions by analyzing
bond yields, credit spreads, currency strength, and commodity proxies.

It calculates a 'Liquidity Stress Index' that serves as a fundamental input
for Risk Agents and Portfolio Managers.

agents.name: InstitutionalRadarAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for executing the Institutional Radar blueprint:
Ingesting 13F data, analyzing trends, and generating narrative reports.

agents.name: CounterpartyRiskAgent
agents.docstring: Responsibility: PFE, Wrong-Way Risk (WWR).

agents.name: QuantumStrategyAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized Agent that orchestrates the AdamVanGrover simulation and
Quantum Recommendation Engine to generate high-level strategic advice.

agents.name: CovenantAnalystAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 3 Helper: Covenant Analysis.
Parses credit agreements (or simulates them) for maintenance covenants.

This agent simulates the role of a Legal/Credit analyst reviewing the Credit Agreement.
It checks for Financial Maintenance Covenants (Total Net Leverage, Interest Coverage)
and estimates the risk of a "Foot Fault" or technical default.

agents.name: CreditRiskControllerAgent
agents.docstring:
The 'Senior Credit Risk Controller' Agent.

A digital twin of a Regulatory Examiner/Senior Credit Officer.

Directives:
1. Ingest granular facility data (SNCnet schema).
2. Deterministically calculate implied ratings (S&P/Moody's logic).
3. Simulate Regulatory Disagreement (SNC Review logic).
4. Generate defense-ready eSNC Cover Pages.

Architecture:
- Pre-Computation Layer: Python-based execution of the S&P Matrix and Conviction Score formula.
- Inference Layer: LLM-based construction of the "Defense Narrative" and qualitative synthesis.

agents.name: ForensicAccountantAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized agent for detecting financial fraud and anomalies in ledger data.
Uses statistical methods (Benford's Law) and heuristic rules.

agents.name: RetailAlphaAgent
agents.docstring:
Retail Alpha Agent: 'The Retail Supplement'

This agent bridges the gap between institutional data (13Fs, Risk Models) and
retail trading needs (Signals, Hype, Simple Metrics).

It generates 'Alpha Signals' by looking for divergences:
- Smart Money Buying vs Retail Selling (Bullish Divergence)
- Smart Money Selling vs Retail Euphoria (Bearish Trap)

agents.name: BlindspotAgent
agents.docstring:
Protocol: ADAM-V-NEXT
A meta-cognitive agent responsible for scanning the system's knowledge graph
for disconnected nodes, contradictory data points, and 'unknown unknowns'.

agents.name: NarrativeIntelligenceAgent
agents.docstring:
Protocol: ADAM-V-NEXT
Specialized agent that moves beyond simple sentiment scoring to identify
emerging thematic narratives (e.g., 'AI Bubble', 'Energy Crisis').

agents.name: PeerComparisonAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 2 Helper: Peer Comparison.
Fetches and calculates relative multiples.

agents.name: QuantumRiskAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized agent that uses Quantum Monte Carlo methods for risk analysis.
Part of the Adam v24.0 'Quantum-Native' suite.

agents.name: RiskCoPilotAgent
agents.docstring: Automated Credit Risk Officer capable of diagnosing breaches and summarizing risk.

agents.name: SentinelAgent
agents.docstring:
The Data Integrity Guardian.
Responsibility: Ingestion, Extraction, Validation against FIBO Schema.

agents.name: TechnicalCovenantAgent
agents.docstring:
Specialized Agent: The Legal Analyst (Law Firm Associate Persona).

This agent focuses purely on the textual "rules of the road" within the Credit Agreement.
It identifies definitions, baskets, and blockers.

Enhanced Capabilities:
- Context-Aware Checking: Prioritizes checks based on borrower history (e.g., Aggressive Sponsors).
- Historical Precedent: Flags "Market Standard" vs "Outlier" terms.

agents.name: QuantumRetrievalAgent
agents.docstring:
An agent that uses Quantum Annealing simulations optimized by Adam
to "retrieve" data from massive unstructured datasets (simulated).
Enhanced to support Credit & Restructuring Search.

agents.name: MonteCarloRiskAgent
agents.docstring:
Quantitative Risk Agent using Monte Carlo simulations.

Methodology:
1. Models EBITDA as a stochastic process (Geometric Brownian Motion, Heston, or OU).
2. Runs iterations (default 10,000) over a defined horizon.
3. Triggers 'Default' if EBITDA falls below Interest Expense + Maintenance Capex.

Developer Note:
---------------
Now supports Heston (stochastic volatility) and OU (mean reversion).

agents.name: PortfolioManagerAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 5: Synthesis & Conviction.
The 'Conviction Engine' that weighs all previous phases.

agents.name: DistressedSurveillanceAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for identifying 'Zombie Issuers' in the BSL market.
Wraps the SurveillanceGraph.

agents.name: InstitutionalTrendAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for monitoring institutional capital flows via 13F filings
and generating strategic market intelligence reports.

Architecture:
1. Ingestion Layer (Hard Logic): Fetches raw 13F data via Sec13FHandler.
2. Processing Layer (Pandas): Calculates deltas (New/Exits/Increases).
3. Cognitive Layer (LLM): Synthesizes quantitative moves into qualitative strategy.

agents.name: QuantumScenarioAgent
agents.docstring:
Phase 4 Helper: Quantum Scenario Generation.

This agent bridges the gap between classical risk modeling and quantum-enhanced simulation.
It utilizes the `QuantumMonteCarloEngine` (QMC) for structural credit modeling and the
`GenerativeRiskEngine` (GRE) for tail-risk scenario generation.

Developer Note:
---------------
In environments without a QPU or heavy GPU dependencies, this agent gracefully degrades
to use classical approximations (numpy-based QMC simulation) and heuristic-based
generative models.

agents.name: TemplateAgent
agents.docstring:
A template for creating v23-compatible agents.

This class demonstrates:
1. Asynchronous task execution.
2. Tool usage via the tool manager.
3. Interaction with the Unified Knowledge Graph (UKG).
4. Structured error handling and logging.

agents.name: AdaptiveRPCAgent
agents.docstring:
V23.5 'Apex' Agent with Metacognitive Gating.

Implements the 'Protocol Paradox' resolution:
1. JSON-RPC 2.0 Native: Speaks standard MCP.
2. Heuristic 1 (Ambiguity Guardrail): Reverts to text if conviction is low.
3. Heuristic 2 (Context Budgeting): Just-in-Time tool loading.

agents.name: AgentInput
agents.docstring: Standard input for a v26 Agent.

agents.name: AgentOutput
agents.docstring: Standard output for a v26 Agent.

agents.name: TemplateAgentV26
agents.docstring:
A template for creating Adam v26.0 (System 2) Agents.

Adheres to:
- Strict Typing (Pydantic)
- Grounding (Source Citation)
- Error Handling (Graceful Degradation)

agents.name: PlannerAgent
agents.docstring:
The PlannerAgent takes a high-level feature request or bug report
and breaks it down into a detailed, structured plan with discrete,
verifiable steps. This plan can then be executed by other agents
in the developer swarm.

agents.name: SpecArchitectAgent
agents.docstring:
The SpecArchitectAgent is the 'Architect' in the Spec-Driven Development workflow.
Its sole purpose is to take a high-level vision or goal and produce a rigorous,
structured SPEC.md file. It operates in 'Plan Mode' (read-only) and does not
write application code.

agents.name: ReviewerAgent
agents.docstring:
The ReviewerAgent checks code for style guide violations (PEP 8),
potential bugs, and adherence to architectural principles.

agents.name: IntegrationAgent
agents.docstring:
The IntegrationAgent merges code, tests, and documentation into the
main branch once all checks have passed.

agents.name: CoderAgent
agents.docstring:
The CoderAgent takes a specific task from a plan and writes the
Python code to implement it.

agents.name: DocumentationAgent
agents.docstring:
The DocumentationAgent writes and updates documentation based on the
code changes made by the CoderAgent.

agents.name: CreditAgentBase
agents.docstring:
Base class for all Credit Memo agents.
Enforces audit logging and strict output schemas.

agents.name: ArchivistAgent
agents.docstring:
The Retrieval Agent.
Responsible for fetching documents and chunks from the Vector DB (mocked).

agents.name: WriterAgent
agents.docstring:
The Generation Agent.
Responsible for synthesizing the final credit memo and inserting citations.

agents.name: QuantAgent
agents.docstring:
The Spreading Agent.
Responsible for extracting structured financial data from unstructured documents.

agents.name: CreditOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Orchestrates the Credit Memo generation process.
Coordinates: Archivist -> Quant -> RiskOfficer -> Writer.

agents.name: InternalSystemsAgent
agents.docstring:
The Internal Systems Agent serves as the secure and reliable conduit to the
financial institution's own internal systems of record. It acts as the "source
of truth" for all data related to the institution's existing relationship
with the borrower.

agents.name: FinancialDocumentAgent
agents.docstring:
The Financial Document Agent is designed to eliminate one of the most time-consuming
and error-prone bottlenecks in traditional credit analysis: manual data entry from
physical or digital documents. This agent leverages state-of-the-art AI-powered
technologies to automate the ingestion and structuring of financial information.

Its primary tool is an advanced Optical Character Recognition (OCR) engine,
enhanced with machine learning models trained specifically on financial document layouts.

agents.name: ComplianceKYCAgent
agents.docstring:
Operating as a critical gatekeeper for regulatory adherence, the Compliance & KYC
Agent automates the essential checks required for client onboarding and ongoing
monitoring. This agent interfaces directly, via secure APIs, with a suite of
internal and external databases.

agents.name: DataIngestionAgent
agents.docstring:
Agent responsible for data ingestion tasks using the Gold Standard Toolkit.
Handles daily history downloads, intraday snapshots, and schema validation.

Version: Adam v24 (Sprint 1: Sensory Layer)

agents.name: MarketAlternativeDataAgent
agents.docstring:
To build a truly comprehensive and forward-looking risk profile, the system must
look beyond the borrower's own financial disclosures. The Market & Alternative
Data Agent is tasked with this "outside-in" view. It continuously scans and
ingests a wide spectrum of both structured and unstructured information from
the public domain.

agents.name: RepoGuardianAgent
agents.docstring:
The RepoGuardian Agent serves as an automated code reviewer and gatekeeper.
It analyzes proposed changes against repository standards and provides
structured feedback.

agents.name: CapacityPlannerAgent
agents.docstring:
Monitors system telemetry (CPU, GPU, Memory) and recommends infrastructure scaling actions.
Functions as the "Site Reliability Engineer" (SRE) of the Analyst OS.

agents.name: NewsDeskOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Editor-in-Chief of 'Market Mayhem'.
Orchestrates NewsBot, SentimentEngine, and MarketDataAPI to generate the weekly newsletter.

agents.name: CreditSentryOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
The Orchestrator/Supervisor Agent. This is the central nervous system of the
copilot. It acts as the primary interface with the human user and the master
controller of the entire workflow.

agents.name: OdysseyHubAgent
agents.docstring:
Adam v25.5 (Odyssey Orchestrator)
The central Hub agent for the Odyssey Financial System.
Orchestrates the 'Hub-and-Spoke' architecture and enforces semantic consistency
via the Odyssey Unified Knowledge Graph (OUKG).

agents.name: PersonaCommunicationAgent
agents.docstring:
The Persona & Communication Agent is the final layer in the output chain,
acting as the system's "finishing school." Its sole purpose is to tailor the
presentation of the final output to the specific needs, role, and authority
level of the human user interacting with the system.

agents.name: AutoArchitectAgent
agents.docstring:
Scans the repository to generate a real-time 'Current State' architectural document.
Ensures documentation never drifts from code.

agents.name: CrisisSimulationMetaAgent
agents.docstring:
A meta-agent that conducts dynamic, enterprise-grade crisis simulations.
It uses a sophisticated prompt structure to simulate the cascading effects of
risks based on a user-defined scenario.

agents.name: ChronosAgent
agents.docstring:
Chronos is the Keeper of Time and Memory.

It manages the temporal state of the application, determining which memory context
(short-term, medium-term, long-term) is most relevant via the `_retrieve_memories` logic.
It also draws parallels between current events and historic financial periods using
LLM-driven historical analysis.

agents.name: CreditRiskAssessmentAgent
agents.docstring:
This agent is the central analytical engine of the system, responsible for
conducting a comprehensive commercial credit analysis that mirrors the rigor
of a seasoned human underwriter.

agents.name: DidacticArchitectAgent
agents.docstring:
The Didactic Architect Agent is a meta-agent designed to build modular,
self-contained, portable, and complementary tutorials and setups.
It bridges the gap between code and comprehension.

agents.name: OdysseyMetaAgent
agents.docstring:
Strategic Synthesis Agent.
Aggregates inputs from Sentinel, CreditSentry, Argus, etc. to produce final XML decision.

agents.name: SkillHarvesterAgent
agents.docstring:
Crawls the agent swarm to extract 'get_skill_schema' definitions
and compiles a structured registry JSON for the Agent Gallery and MCP.

agents.name: CounterpartyRiskAgent
agents.docstring:
For clients engaging in derivative transactions (e.g., interest rate swaps,
currency forwards), the system's dedicated CounterpartyRiskAgent is activated.
This agent is specifically designed to quantify the complex, contingent risks
associated with these instruments.

agents.name: EvolutionaryArchitectAgent
agents.docstring:
The Evolutionary Architect Agent is a meta-agent predisposed for action.
It drives the codebase forward by proposing additive enhancements, refactors,
and optimizations. It uses 'Active Inference' principles to minimize the
divergence between the current codebase state and the desired goal state.

agents.name: DidacticArchitect
agents.docstring:
The Didactic Architect is responsible for bridging the gap between code and comprehension.
It generates software development tutorials, setup guides, and ensures components are
built to be modular, self-contained, and portable. It turns the 'what' into the 'how'.

agents.name: PortfolioMonitoringEWSAgent
agents.docstring:
This agent is the system's vigilant sentinel, responsible for continuous,
real-time surveillance of the entire credit portfolio. Its function is to
move the institution from a reactive to a proactive risk management posture.

agents.name: EvolutionaryArchitect
agents.docstring:
The Evolutionary Architect is a meta-agent predisposed for action.
It drives, enhances, refines, and builds additively onto the codebase.
It seeks to 'mutate' the system beneficially by proposing and scaffolding
new features, modules, and optimizations without breaking existing functionality.

agents.name: NarrativeSummarizationAgent
agents.docstring:
This agent functions as the system's dedicated writer, editor, and communicator.
Its purpose is to bridge the gap between complex, quantitative machine output
and the need for clear, concise, and context-rich human understanding.

agents.name: TechnicalAnalyst
agents.docstring:
Advanced technical analysis module for analyzing price data, CDS spreads,
and other market signals, generating trading signals across various asset classes.

This module integrates with Adam's agent framework to access data from various sources
and collaborates with other agents like the CDSSpreadAgent for a comprehensive analysis.

Features:
    - Calculates various technical indicators (SMA, RSI, MACD, Bollinger Bands, etc.)
    - Trains and utilizes a Random Forest model for signal generation
    - Integrates CDS spread analysis for credit risk assessment
    - Analyzes order book data and capital stack information (if available)
    - Provides functionalities for analyzing derivatives data
    - Expandable for incorporating additional technical analysis methods

Future Enhancements:
    - Implement pattern recognition (e.g., candlestick patterns, chart patterns)
    - Integrate sentiment analysis from news and social media
    - Incorporate seasonality and cyclical patterns
    - Develop more sophisticated ML models (e.g., deep learning)
    - Add risk management and position sizing strategies

agents.name: FundamentalAnalyst
agents.docstring:
Hybrid Agent specialized in fundamental analysis. 
Capable of both LLM-driven agentic research (via yfinance) and 
deterministic financial modeling (DCF, Ratio Analysis) using provided data.

agents.name: MultimodalAnalyst
agents.docstring:
Specialized analyst for extracting structured data from financial visuals.
Part of the Adam v24.0 'Vision' suite.

agents.name: AgentState
agents.docstring:
The shared state for the Cyclical Reasoning Graph.
Uses Pydantic for validation, compatible with LangGraph.

agents.name: MetaOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
The 'Brain' of the Adam system.
Routes requests based on Semantic Understanding rather than keywords.

agents.name: SelfReflectionAgent
agents.docstring:
The 'Senior Editor' agent.
Critiques drafts against a 'Constitution' of financial reporting standards.

agents.name: AuditorAgent
agents.docstring:
A specialized 'LLM-as-a-Judge' agent that performs a Hybrid Audit:
1. Deterministic Heuristics: Checks math, specific data presence, and terminology via code/regex.
2. Semantic Evaluation: Uses LLM to judge reasoning quality, incorporating heuristic findings.

It evaluates other agents' reasoning objectively based on input data vs output text.

agents.name: AgentOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Manages the creation, execution, and communication of agents.
This version incorporates MCP and A2A, and leverages Semantic Kernel.

agents.name: AgentSnapshot
agents.docstring: Schema for a point-in-time snapshot of an agent's state.

agents.name: StateManager
agents.docstring: Manages the serialization and retrieval of agent state snapshots ("The Rewind Button").

agents.name: NexusZeroOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Nexus-Zero Protocol Implementation.
Orchestrates the "Deconstruct -> Query -> Simulate -> Synthesis" flow.
Automates context loading and execution sequence.

agents.name: AgentImprovementPipeline
agents.docstring: A module to manage the process of improving an agent.

agents.name: AgentNotFoundError
agents.docstring: Raised when a requested agent is not found or cannot be loaded.

agents.name: AgentExecutionError
agents.docstring: Raised by an agent if it has a problem with it's execute method.

agents.name: HybridOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Enterprise-grade orchestrator that bridges v22 asynchronous execution 
with v23 synchronous/cyclical reasoning.

agents.name: AgenticOversightFramework
agents.docstring:
Implements the Agentic Oversight Framework (AOF) as described in the Agentic Convergence Whitepaper.
Enforces "Deterministic HITL Triggers" and the "Four Eyes" principle.

agents.name: MemoryManager
agents.docstring:
Manages the long-term memory of the system using a local JSON store.
Stores analysis history to allow agents to recall past insights.

agents.name: VectorMemoryManager
agents.docstring: Enhanced Memory Manager with Vector Search capabilities.

agents.name: AsyncAgentBase
agents.docstring:
Abstract base class for asynchronous agents in the v22 system.
Enhanced with Adaptive Conviction, State Anchors, and Subscription Patterns.

agents.name: StateAnchorManager
agents.docstring:
Implements State Anchors to prevent State Drift in asynchronous workflows.
"Heuristic 3: The Asynchronous State Anchor"

agents.name: SubscriptionManager
agents.docstring:
Manages event subscriptions with damping to prevent Interrupt Storms.
Implements the "Subscription/Notification" pattern.

agents.name: AgentTrace
agents.docstring:
Container for a full session or task execution.
Manages the narrative arc of the agent's work.

agents.name: AuditAgent
agents.docstring: Automated 'Audit Agent' that verifies compliance with Architectural Decision Records (ADRs).

agents.name: StrategyManager
agents.docstring: Manages the lifecycle of trading strategies: Generation, Backtesting, and Optimization.

agents.name: EACIOrchestrator
agents.docstring:
Enterprise Adaptive Core Interface (EACI) v2.1 Orchestrator.

Manages the lifecycle of high-level intents to low-level MCP tool calls.
Features:
- Asynchronous execution pipeline.
- Backward compatibility for synchronous callers.
- Internal Agent registration & routing.
- Enhanced Regex-based intent decomposition.

agents.name: CodeWeaverAgent
agents.docstring:
Appendix C: "Code Weaver" Self-Maintenance Agent v2.0.

A specialized agent that scans the Monorepo for technical debt.
It uses Abstract Syntax Trees (AST) for deep Python analysis and 
Regex patterns for polyglot support (Rust, JS, Markdown).

agents.name: ReviewerAgent
agents.docstring: Critiques reports generated by other agents for consistency, quality, and risk.

agents.name: QuantitativeAnalyst
agents.docstring: A V30 agent that performs real-time technical analysis on market data.

agents.name: NewsBotAgent
agents.docstring: Appendix B: NewsBot Sentiment Analysis Pipeline

agents.name: FundamentalAnalyst
agents.docstring:
Analyzes company fundamentals using simulated 10-K data and earnings transcripts.
Calculates intrinsic value, distress risk (Altman Z), and quality (Pietroski F).
